jMusicMetaManager

Class ParseiTunesXMLFileHandler

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.xml.sax.helpers.DefaultHandler
      • jMusicMetaManager.ParseiTunesXMLFileHandler
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    org.xml.sax.ContentHandler, org.xml.sax.DTDHandler, org.xml.sax.EntityResolver, org.xml.sax.ErrorHandler

    public class ParseiTunesXMLFileHandler
extends org.xml.sax.helpers.DefaultHandler
    An extension of the Xerces XML DefaultHandler class. The methods of this class are called by an instance of an XMLReader while it is parsing an XML document.

    This particular implementation is used to parse iTunes XML files. After parsing, the metadata for each recording can be obtained from the extracted_metadata field.

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      RecordingMetaData[] extracted_metadata
      The metadata parsed from an iTunes XML file.

    • Field Detail

      • extracted_metadata

        public RecordingMetaData[] extracted_metadata
        The metadata parsed from an iTunes XML file. Each entry corresponds to the metadata from a different recording.

      • startElement

        public void startElement(java.lang.String namespace,
                         java.lang.String name,
                         java.lang.String qName,
                         org.xml.sax.Attributes atts)
                  throws org.xml.sax.SAXException
        This method is called when the start tag of an XML element is encounterd during parsing. It causes the name of the start element to be stored.
        Specified by:
        startElement in interface org.xml.sax.ContentHandler
        Overrides:
        startElement in class org.xml.sax.helpers.DefaultHandler
        Parameters:
        namespace - Inherited from DefaultHandler.
        name - Name of the element that is encountered.
        qName - Inherited from DefaultHandler.
        atts - The attributes encountered.
        Throws:
        org.xml.sax.SAXException - Exception thrown if is wrong type of XML file.

      • endElement

        public void endElement(java.lang.String namespace,
                       java.lang.String name,
                       java.lang.String qname)
        This method is called when the end tag of an XML element is encounterd during parsing. It causes the value of a metadata field to be stored, if appropriate.
        Specified by:
        endElement in interface org.xml.sax.ContentHandler
        Overrides:

      • characters

        public void characters(char[] ch,
                       int start,
                       int length)
        Called when the contents of an XML tag are parsed.
        Specified by:
        characters in interface org.xml.sax.ContentHandler
        Overrides:
        characters in class org.xml.sax.helpers.DefaultHandler
        Parameters:
        ch - Contains the characters parsed from the XML tag.
        start - Where in ch to start looking for this tag's content.
        length - Information on where in ch to stop looking for this tag's content.
